title: (x) "Gyllene Tider" script - Palace Script (modified) {Mike F}
content:
Well, the three 'E's are different.   
I guess this is a lettering thing.
author: Eduardo Omine

comments.content:
See [Palace Script MT Semibold](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142346/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/palace-script/mt-semi-bold/testdrive.html?s=Gyllene%20Tider&p=72). Artificially bolded   
and with a modified T, you'd be mighty close.

I would agree with Mike (he posted his before I finished writing mine :-). A lettering artist would not have done an "i" like that. The difference in the lowercase "e"s could just be bad reproduction.
a lettering artist would not listen to the music of the Swedish band Gyllene Tider either : )

I think I could probably make Adobe Palace Script SemiBold fit with a bit more work.   
 ![Gyllene](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142346im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/25031.jpg)   
The T has clearly been seriously altered. The whole thing has been converted to curves and lc x-height, baseline shift and squooshing� freely manipulated.   
   
Getting the slant angle right obviously depends on having exactly the right x-height, tracking/kerning and squoosh�, which I think are all a bit off in my attempt.   
   
EDIT: It may of course have started with a different cut of Palace Script.\</font\>\</font\>

_(And sorry for the much I'm bothering you all.)_   
   
Are you kidding? This is our idea of fun. :-)
As Mark said, this is our idea of fun, so you are always welcome to bring questions. But start a new thread for each question and we'll see what we can do to help.
Also SM register and have some fun with us

Hey SM i am sorry.. please come back...!1!   
   
although i am not very fond of Gyllene Tider... i was just trying (as usual) to be funny..   
   
You should join this forum! here is a real horrorshow of fun albeit my silly twistings of words and comments.   
   
and judging from all the blushings i reckon you are female.. or perhaps just a guy who likes Gyllene Tider : ) he he   
   
either way come and join us!   
   
   
jack the flipper

Again, thank you everyone, for all the kind words. :-) Oh, and as for having not registered from the start, well, that was only because, as I said, my appearence in this forum is most likely to be rather occasional I guess... Well, either way, still, registration is done. :-)   
   
And, jack K. davidson, no, no need to say sorry, absolutely, not at all, please! :-) I mean, it wasn't even about your comment in itself, which I fully respect. (Your words only stated an opinion. Something to which every person is entitled to. Or ought to be anyway. Sadly enough our world doesn't always roll in the right direction, but, that's another story of course...) It was more the fact of... well, of someone (in the case, you) recognizing the "source" of the logo I presented... It just felt like, in that moment, the spotlight had turned on, pointing right at me, and saying: "So, you like Gyllene Tider!", if you understand what I mean? :-) And, truth is, I am not that much fond of being in the spotlight really... :-) As I said, actually I'm rather a shy person... discrete... reserved... And although yes, indeed I do follow and enjoy the work of the Swedish music artists Per Gessle and Marie Fredriksson, also true is that I keep it as something... well, personal... personal to the point of blushing, when it is noticed, yeah, oh dear, do I feel ashamed... :-) So I guess in the end the blushing did "denounce" me, huh? :-) Yes, you reckon right, caught me there. ;-) Sandra is the name. (Although... a guy is entitled to blush too... isn't he? ;-)) And also to you I thank for all the kindness. But please, please don't say sorry, there's no reason for that. At all! :-)   
   
And so now, and if may, I'd then like to request your help on trying to identify another font. Off to start a new thread then. And thank you. :-)
